docs.lead_paragraph: New information on payments by pharmaceutical and medical device manufacturers is being made public this week as part of the Affordable Care Act.

headline.main: What We’re Learning About Drug Company Payments to Doctors
headline.print_headline: Time Arrives for Drug Makers to Reveal Payments to Doctors

docs.abstract: The Upshot; new information on payments to doctors by pharmaceutical and medical device manufacturers is being made public as part of the Affordable Care Act; researchers at ProPublica describe facts learned from data gleaned from websites of large drug companies.
docs.snippet: New information on payments by pharmaceutical and medical device manufacturers is being made public this week as part of the Affordable Care Act.

keywords.value: Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act (2010)
keywords.name: subject

byline.contributor: Charles Ornstein is a senior reporter for ProPublica, an independent, nonprofit newsroom that produces investigative journalism in the public interest. Ryann Grochowski Jones is a data reporter at ProPublica, and Eric Sagara was a news applications fellow.
byline.original: By CHARLES ORNSTEIN, RYANN GROCHOWSKI JONES  and ERIC SAGARA

docs.lead_paragraph: People hate to shop around, particularly for things as complicated as health insurance. But that may open the door to bigger rate increases.

headline.main: Auto-Renewing Your Health Plan May Be Bad for You, and for Competition

docs.snippet: People hate to shop around, particularly for things as complicated as health insurance. But that may open the door to bigger rate increases.

headline.main: Can a Company Reimburse Employees Who Buy Their Own Health Insurance? Maybe

docs.abstract: Employers may not know whether such a post-tax arrangement is legal until they try it.
docs.snippet: Employers may not know whether such a post-tax arrangement is legal until they try it.

docs.lead_paragraph: Potential 2016 Republican presidential candidate Jeb Bush weighed in to a key midterm election race on Monday, telling a Kansas fundraiser for struggling Sen. Pat Roberts that the incumbent must be re-elected so the GOP can take control of the Senate and "fix a few big things" in Washington.

headline.main: Jeb Bush Says GOP Would 'Fix a Few Big Things'
headline.print_headline: Jeb Bush Says GOP Would 'Fix a Few Big Things'

docs.snippet: Potential 2016 Republican presidential candidate Jeb Bush weighed in to a key midterm election race on Monday, telling a Kansas fundraiser for struggling Sen. Pat Roberts that the incumbent must be re-elected so the GOP can take control of the Senate...

docs.lead_paragraph: Humana Inc, which manages private Medicare and individual Obamacare insurance plans, said on Monday it has integrated its consumer health application with Apple Inc's HealthKit.

headline.main: Humana to Integrate Its Health Application With Apple's HealthKit
headline.print_headline: Humana to Integrate Its Health Application With Apple's HealthKit

docs.lead_paragraph: A northeast Ohio teenager who said she killed her foster mother in 2012 at the urging of the dead woman's husband was sentenced to life in prison on Monday.

headline.main: Teenager Gets Life in Foster Mom's Stabbing Death
headline.print_headline: Teenager Gets Life in Foster Mom's Stabbing Death

docs.snippet: A northeast Ohio teenager who said she killed her foster mother in 2012 at the urging of the dead woman's husband was sentenced to life in prison on Monday.

headline.main: Why Are Republicans in Favor of Over-the-Counter Birth Control?

docs.abstract: Republican candidates want to make birth control pills available over the counter. Is this a ploy to lure women voters, or will the change help women gain access to contraception?
docs.snippet: Republican candidates want to make birth control pills available over the counter. Is this a ploy to lure women voters, or will the change help women gain access to contraception?

keywords.value: Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act (2010)
keywords.name: subject

docs.lead_paragraph: Emergency room physicians are leaving patients with hefty bills: More and more, doctors who work in emergency rooms are private contractors who are out of network or do not accept any insurance plans.

headline.main: Costs Can Go Up Fast When E.R. Is in Network but the Doctors Are Not
headline.print_headline: Costs Can Go Up Fast When E.R. Is in Network but the Doctors Are Not

docs.abstract: Emergency room patients are increasingly facing hefty bills due to the fact that more and more doctors who work in emergency rooms are private contractors and do not accept any insurance plans; researchers in Texas report that out-of-network payments to emergency room physicians account for 40 to 70 percent of money spent on emergency care at in-network hospitals.
docs.snippet: Emergency room physicians are leaving patients with hefty bills: More and more, doctors who work in emergency rooms are private contractors who are out of network or do not accept any insurance plans.

docs.lead_paragraph: Maurice R. Greenberg’s lawsuit against the government will head to court on Monday, the European Central Bank is meeting Thursday, and American jobs figures are due on Friday.

headline.main: A.I.G. Bailout Lawsuit, Eurozone Stimulus and U.S. Jobs Data

docs.snippet: Maurice R. Greenberg’s lawsuit against the government will head to court on Monday, the European Central Bank is meeting Thursday, and American jobs figures are due on Friday.
